title: Virat Kohli sets record as India dominate South Africa in second Test
text:
Virat Kohli scored a double century as India continued to dominate South Africa (Picture: AP)

Virat Kohli scored an Indian record seventh Test double century as his team continued to dominate South Africa in the second Test in Pune.

Resuming on 273-3, Kohli took his score from 63 to 254 not out as India declared on 601-5 before reducing South Africa to 36-3, with Umesh Yadav taking two wickets.

South Africa only took two wickets on day two of the match and now face an uphill battle to avoid defeat.

India secured an emphatic 203-run victory in the opening Test and find themselves in a strong position in Pune after Kohli’s record-breaking seventh Test double ton.

Kohli’s side are on top in Pune (Picture: AP)

Kohli’s 254 off 336 balls was his highest score in Test cricket and saw him surpass Sachin Tendulkar and Virender Sehwag, who both amassed six double centuries in the longest format of the game.

The 30-year-old is now joint-fourth on the all-time list, alongside England legend Wally Hammond and Sri Lanka great Mahela Jayawardene.

Australian hero Sir Donald Bradman holds the overall record with 12.

The third Test between India and South Africa takes place in Ranchi.
